de.db.derPate.manager

Class LoginManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.db.derPate.manager.LoginManager

  • public class LoginManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to read and write login data (see LoginUser) to the client's HttpSession.
    Pattern: Singleton
    Author:
    MichelBlank
    See Also:
    LoginUser

      private java.lang.String userKey

      Returns LoginUser that is connected with this session.

      Returns current login status

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static @NonNull LoginManager getInstance()
        Returns instance of LoginManager
        Returns:
        LoginManager

      • getUserBySession

        public @Nullable LoginUser getUserBySession(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Returns LoginUser that is connected with this session. May return null, if user was not logged in.
        Parameters:
        session - Session of which the LoginUser should be read from
        Returns:
        LoginUser

      • login

        public boolean login(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                     LoginUser user)
        Connects HttpSession with LoginUser
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        user - LoginUser
        Returns:
        true, if successful; false if an error occurred

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Returns current login status
        Parameters:
        session - HttpSession
        Returns:
        true, if user is logged in; false, if user is not

      • logout

        public boolean logout(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        Removes connection between HttpSession and LoginUser
        Parameters:
        session - HttpSession
        Returns:
        true, if successful; false, if not

      • newSession

        private javax.servlet.http.HttpSession newSession(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Destroys old session and creates a new one to prevent session hijacking.
        Should be called before every login and after every logout.
        Caution: All session attributed will be gone after this method was executed!
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        Returns:
        new HttpSession
